[[(LPH) Amphibious Assault Ship|Amphibious Assault Ship]] conversions |Class after= [[Tarawa-class amphibious assault ship|''Tarawa''-class amphibious assault ship]] |Subclasses= |Built range= |In commission range=1961-2002 |Total ships building= |Total ships planned= |Total ships completed=7 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active=0 |Total ships laid up=1 |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired=7 |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type=[[(LPH) Amphibious Assault Ship|Amphibious Assault Ship]] (LPH) |Ship displacement=18,474 tons ([[full displacement|full]]) <br/>11,000 tons ([[light displacement|light]]) |Ship length={{convert|592|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|84|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|27|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=2 × {{convert|600|psi|MPa|abbr=on}} boilers, <br/>one geared steam turbine, <br/>one shaft, <br/>22,000 shaft horsepower (16 [[Megawatt|MW]]) |Ship speed={{convert|22|kn|km/h}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=667 |Ship troops=2,157 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament='''Initially:'''<br/>4 × {{convert|3|in|mm|0|adj=on}} / 50 [[Caliber#Caliber as measurement of length|caliber]] AA guns<br/>'''Later:'''<br/>2 × {{convert|3|in|mm|0|adj=on}} / 50 caliber AA guns,<br/>8 cell [[Sea Sparrow]] BPDMS launchers,<br/>2 × [[Phalanx CIWS]] |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities=25 helicopters or [[Harrier Jump Jet|AV-8 Harriers]]<br/>Flight deck width: {{convert|105|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship notes= }} |} The '''''Iwo Jima''-class''' [[amphibious assault ships]] of the [[United States Navy]] were the first [[amphibious assault ship]]s designed and built as dedicated [[helicopter carrier]]s, capable of operating up to 20 [[helicopter]]s to carry up to 1,800 marines ashore. They were named for battles featuring the [[United States Marine Corps]], starting with the [[Battle of Iwo Jima]]. The first ship of the class was commissioned in 1961, and the last was decommissioned in 2002. Because these ships bore the hull classification of LPH they have often been referred to as "[[Landing Platform Helicopter|Landing Platform, Helicopter]]". Ships of the class: * {{USS|Iwo Jima|LPH-2}} * {{USS|Okinawa|LPH-3}} * {{USS|Guadalcanal|LPH-7}} * {{USS|Guam|LPH-9}} * {{USS|Tripoli|LPH-10}} * {{USS|New Orleans|LPH-11}} * {{USS|Inchon|LPH-12}} ==Popular culture== <!-- See [[WP:MILPOP]] for inclusion rules, this is extremely borderline --> One of the Iwo Jima class ships served as the fieldsite in [[Edwin Hutchins]]'s classic [[cognitive science]] study ''Cognition in the Wild''.<ref>{{cite book|last = Hutchins ||first = Edwin |title= Cognition in the Wild |year = 1995|publisher = [[MIT Press]]}}</ref> Although Hutchins does not mention the ship class by name, on p.7 he characterizes it as a {{convert|603|ft|m|adj=mid|-long}} amphibious [[helicopter carrier]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} * [http://www.hazegray.org/navhist/carriers/us_assau.htm#iwo-cl hazegray.org: ''Iwo Jima''-class amphibious assault ships] {{Iwo Jima class amphibious assault ship}} [[Category:Amphibious warfare vessel classes]] [[Category:Helicopter carrier classes]] [[Category:Iwo Jima-class amphibious assault ships| Iwo Jima class amphibious assault ship]] [[Category:Cold War amphibious warfare vessels of the United States| Iwo Jima class amphibious assault ship]] [[Category:Vietnam War amphibious warfare vessels of the United States| Iwo Jima class amphibious assault ship]] {{USN-stub}}
